node.title: The Underwater Acoustic Communication Market And Its Importance
node.body:
With the advancement of science and technology, the communication technology is also getting expanded. Currently, the underwater acoustic communication is gaining a massive popularity and it is considered to be one of the most important technique for receiving and sending messages through underwater. With the medium of hydrophones, one can easily communicate through underwater. Often, underwater communication becomes difficult due to several issues like time variations, multi- path propagation, strong signal attenuation and small bandwidth. With the introduction of the underwater acoustic communication system, people can now navigate, communicate and also monitor under the water through data transmission under the water. The underwater acoustic communication system consists of modems which are mainly used in the military and defense along with the oil and gas industry in order to gather data and monitor the marine applications. The rising research and other developmental activities is giving rise to the growth of the underwater acoustic communication market.

 

Segmentation of the underwater acoustic communication market

The underwater acoustic communication market is classified on the basis of its communication range, interface platform, end-user industry, application and also by regional demand. Based on the interface platform, the underwater acoustic communication market is classified as sensor interface, an acoustic modem and others. On the basis of its communication range, the market is divided into shallow, medium, long water range and full ocean range. Based on its application, the market is divided as hydrography, pollution and environmental monitoring, climate recording, oceanography, and others. End-user industries like oil and gas, military and defense, homeland security, scientific research centers and marine make use of the underwater acoustic communication technology. Based on its regional demand, the underwater acoustic communication market is divided into regions like Europe, North America, Asia- Pacific, Middle East, LATAM, and Africa. Amongst all these regions, North America holds the largest share.

 

Factors affecting the growth of the underwater acoustic communication market

There are several factors that are responsible for the growth of the underwater acoustic communication market. Rising importance of the best and reliable underwater security measure is allowing the growth of the market. Also, growing adoption of the various underwater acoustic modems in the defense industry is boosting the market growth. How do the earth observation satellites work?

 

The earth observation satellites provide us with all the necessary information on various factors such as ice thickness, ocean salinity, air quality, and crop health. The earth observation satellites are divided into two types, based on their way of capturing the images.

  • One is known as the passive earth observation satellite. The passive satellites mainly detect the radiation that gets reflected off from the earth’s surface. These rays are generally infrared and visible light. These satellites do not work through the clouds.
  • Other is known as the active earth observation satellite. The active satellites could work through the clouds. These satellites help in the transmission of energy towards earth by measuring the returned signal that offers all the information about the surface of the earth.

 

The earth observation satellites are placed in different orbits as per their particular functions and in order to study the earth from different perspectives. It can monitor the wind and the ocean currents, pollutant concentration in the air, emission level of greenhouse gases and others. The information that is collected through the earth observation satellites helps in organizing the environmental cleanup and the emergency responders.

node.body:
Sports has always been about entertainment, however, in the past couple of decades, the sporting authorities and organizations have upped their game. From being the mere display of sporting abilities, the game has been turned into complete entertainment package. From on-field drama, sports, to pre-game and end-game events, entertainment is the buzzword. And, now we have even more technology than ever before that elevates the viewer experience further. But, that’s like simply scratching the tip of the iceberg. The true transformation comes with an enhanced live viewing of any sports event and stadiums form an integral part of that experience. Thus, we come across the concept of Smart Stadiums!

 

The sports industry today is trying to meet every needs and demand of every single spectator who will be visiting the arena to watch their favorite match. Digitalization and smart technology are playing major roles in aiding that effort. The live experience of the fans is being refined with the concept of the next-gen venues, thus making way for ‘Smart stadiums’.

 

It’s not merely about the on-field and within stadium experience, the industry is taking a holistic approach towards improving the experience of the crowd through smarter and easier seat booking system, providing a wealth of information on bathroom breaks, seat upgrades, parking upgrade, and many more. What’s more, these arenas have the answer to every type of architectural and technological possibilities. This means that one stadium can now be used for multiple events and the entire architecture can be changed within a matter of hours at most. Also, inside the stadium, the ebb and flow of every human being are tracked every minute with the help of sensors using IoT technologies. The staffs over there can receive every update regarding what’s happening in the venue, which increases their efficiency and the capability to maintain top-level security inside the premises. Smart Stadiums are certainly changing the game altogether.

 

Competing against the at-home experience

There are many fans who stay at home to watch the games. It is a challenge for the sports entertainment industry to lure them away from the comfort of their homes, big-screen TVs, and refrigerators nearby.

 

However, the new capabilities such as augmented reality, interactive seats, and big screens have helped a lot to fight with these challenges. The venue is surrounded by almost thousands of state-of-the-art monitors so that fans do not miss a moment of the game irrespective of where they are seated.

 

Solution overview

Smart stadiums come with an array of sensors, digital signages, and cameras that are connected wirelessly as well as via wired networks between themselves and with the servers. Sensors update every information such as waiting lines, the number of hot dogs that are available at the concession stands, parking spots, and other stadium data. Every corner of the venue is monitored by the cameras to keep people safe.

 

What are the benefits of a smart stadium?

The safety, entertainment, and economic impact that has been created in the smart stadiums can be felt in various ways, such as:

 

Profitability

The stadiums are multi-million-dollar venues, which are, most of the time, paid for by the taxpayers with the knowledge that they will be able to get big economic dividends for the host city. Smart Stadiums are aiding revenue generation by making the process of purchase of tickets, foods, and merchandise easier, faster, and more personalized. It has become quite like online shopping. There are websites today, through which smart stadiums are making the experience of the fans more personalized through their loyalty programs which will reward them for their previous purchases or it can also suggest new items which will be based on their history of purchase. All this is done with the help of data analytics software which will allow the operators of the stadiums to gain more knowledge about their patrons.

 

To lower the cost of their maintenance, the staffs can also monitor the health of everything starting from deep fryers to toilets and can notice when any equipment is starting to show signs of wearing down. This eventually leads them to work promptly on the matter and replace the equipment so that it doesn’t break down at any moment.

 

Fan experience

Every year over a hundred thousand start-ups just in the technology domain are crossing the basic funding stage. Which means they are able to begin their business at a smaller scale. How are the start-ups scripting their success story?

For any entrepreneurial manager reaching this milestone is a huge success in itself. This proves that the technology that was conceptualized has bloomed into a viable commercial opportunity with target customers interested in the product, and investors ready to invest in the company.

This is where the next challenge presents itself – creating a plan as to how to sell the product and create a supportable revenue stream. This is what helps develop further product offerings, repay the investors, build infrastructure, and generate income and create employment. Unfortunately, most tech start-ups get stuck at this point. The ones who are making it past this stage are the ones who are successful in creating a viable Go-To-Market strategy and implement the same.

How to create winning Go-To-Market (GTM) Strategy for Start-Ups?

Creating a GTM Strategy might not seem like the most difficult of all jobs, but it is no child’s play either. Start-ups often fail because they are not expert in every aspect of the business. The ones who are managing a tech-based start-up are more efficient with the technical aspects as compared to the sales and marketing part of the business. Likewise, someone else is an expert in one area and unable to grasp the business in its entirety. Then there is another issue, that the only person who is interested in selling the product is the person who has developed it.

Go-To-Market Strategy sets apart the ones who will succeed from the ones who will perish. So, before you begin, you need to learn to ask the right questions.

Let’s see which are the major questions that the management of the companies are asking when it comes to creating sales and marketing strategy.

  • Should the sales happen by engaging direct sales force, or should it be channeled through others?
  • If the sale is done directly then salesperson should be organized by the industry, company size, market, geography, and other principles?
  • The salesperson which we have, will they require technical support and work in teams?
  • Is it possible to get our products into the market through channels such as advertising or social media?

And, the list goes on.

The problem is, these questions are wrong, to begin with. What a start-up need is to understand the perspective of their customers and then approach the market, but these questions focus on the perspective of the start-ups and their technologies. They must understand the needs of their customers and try to solve the problem and then think about how their products will help them to be successful.

Therefore, if you are a part of a start-up which needs to accelerate revenue growth, you can consider this approach and see whether it works or not. You can start by identifying a small number of customers, either companies or the desired customer segment. Then you can place yourself in the position of the customers and think about their issues by talking to them about the challenges they face and their pain points.

Once these steps are been taken, you become ready to experiment with a go-to-market approach and expect that you will continuously refine and change it based on your further insights and experience.

By now it should be amply clear that the GTM strategy formulation is the basic requirement to ensure that the business remains viable and profitable in the long run. With the global rise in the crude oil price, and the various factors adding fire to the fuel, it waits to be seen how the Indian economy will react. node.alt_text: The Crude Indian Story  An Economy In TurmOIL?
node.body:
Crude oil is one of the most necessitated commodities across the globe and it serves as not only a vital source of energy but also a chief raw material for several industries. Therefore, crude oil prices have a significant impact on the economic growth of any country. High crude oil prices adversely affect the twin deficits of an economy – the current and fiscal account deficit, which further exerts a spillover impact on the consumption, investment behavior and monetary policy of an economy. While oil-exporting nations benefit from surging oil prices, the oil importing countries face higher crude oil import bills that subsequently affect government finances unfavorably. With no significant discoveries or extractions in recent years, the growing production costs have pushed up the prices of crude oil globally. The recent rise in crude oil prices has drawn attention toward the crucial role played by oil exports and imports in any country. Countries that are affected by a hike in oil prices are usually characterized by high net imports of crude oil per GDP. Conventionally, the non-oil producing emerging nations fall under this category as the developed countries are generally more economical in their oil usage and witness an easing of this adverse effect of a rise in prices.

What does the increase in global crude oil price mean for Indian economy?

India, which is posing a double-digit economic growth by certain measures is at present one of the most coveted countries for crude oil exporters among the top five global oil importers including, the U.S., China, India, Japan, and South Korea. India, being the third largest oil importer in the world is one of the most affected economies because of the surging oil prices in the recent months, as the increasing price results in risking reduced current projection for vigorous economic growth, widening the country’s trade deficit and putting more upside pressure on inflation, thereby threatening to exceed the government targets. All this is taking place while the Indian citizens and politicians are about to face a series of upcoming elections in this year as well as the next, with a general election anticipated to be held in 2019 spring. Furthermore, the vast crude oil imports of India results in the spending of huge amounts of foreign exchange. Thus, the rising quantum of import of petroleum products has a substantial impact on the Indian economy, particularly when oil prices are shooting up globally.

Global crude oil prices have been at a steady rise over the past few months. Since 2014, for the first time, the international benchmark for the global oil prices have exceeded the $80/barrel mark in May 2018. The oil prices have witnessed a steep hike in the global market lately, bolstered strongly by a combination of steady demand supply cut by the major oil producers led by the Organisation of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) and the fears of American sanctions against Iran. High oil prices push up rates for diesel and petrol in the country, pose a serious threat to the government finances, induce inflation and boost public demand for subsidies and fuel tax cuts. This rise in prices could exert a great impact on several segments of the Indian economy, for instance:

  • Impact on Fiscal Deficit: India imports approximately 1.5 billion barrels of crude oil every year which comes up to more than 85% of its annual crude oil requirement. Thus, the hike in oil prices could increase the country’s expenditure, negatively impacting its fiscal deficit, that is, the difference between the total revenue and expenditure of the government, and, a rise in this deficit impacts the economy as well as its markets adversely.
  • Impact on Current Account Deficit: India’s dependence on crude on imports have been on a rise over the past years and this has a huge impact on the current account deficit. CAD essentially indicates the amount India owes in foreign currency and a widening CAD further puts pressure on the Indian currency’s value as well on the rest of the economy. A report from SBI suggests India’s current account deficit could exceed 2.5% of GDP for the financial year 2018, provided the oil price continues at $80/barrel.
  • Impact of the Indian Currency: The rise in crude oil price clearly impact the Indian currency or Rupee by depreciating it. The Rupee has been depreciating since the onset of 2018 and it hit its lowest against the U.S. dollar in the last 15 months, in May 2018. Currency depreciation has a reverberating effect on the economy as well as the stock market and if oil prices remain this steep, the Rupee is expected to further depreciate by the year-end
  • Impact on Sensex and Stock: The stock markets in India is facing a lot of pressure with the hike in crude oil process. The Sensex fell by 2.3% between 1st and 24th May 2018 alone. There has also been a sell-off in mid and small cap stocks, with oil prices touching $80/barrel. Further, several Indian companies such as lubricants, airline, refining, tyre and footwear companies are dependent on healthy crude oil prices. Higher input costs adversely affect the profitability of these companies and this could negatively impact stock prices in the near term.
  • Impact on Inflation: Oil is a very important commodity in any economy, required to meet the domestic fuel needs and is a necessary raw material across various industries. Thus, an increase in crude oil price implies an increased cost of goods production. This rise in price would be finally passed on to the end-users, subsequently resulting in inflation. Experts opine that a surge of $10/barrel in oil prices is capable of raising inflation by 0.1%.

The net trade oil deficit in India has considerably widened and this can be attributed to high oil prices and a weak rupee. The crude oil import bill of India swelled by a quarter in the FY 2017-2018 from $70 billion in the previous fiscal year as the prices rose steeply, as per the ministry’s petroleum planning and analysis cell. The average price of Indian basket crude rose up 19% at $56.4/barrel in FY 2017-18 from $47.6 in 2016-17. Owing to India’s heavy reliance on imported crude oil, the impact of surging oil prices has resulted in a substantial increase in the oil import bill for the country. The petroleum and natural gas ministry has estimated that India’s crude oil import bill might increase 20% to $105 billion in this financial year from $88 billion in 2017-18, assuming the average crude oil price as $65/barrel for the year.

node.alt_text: Apple Smartwatch Gives Parkinsons Disease Treatment New Tech Boost
node.body:
Parkinson’s disease is a progressive central nervous system disorder that mostly affects the motor system or movements. It is a neurodegenerative disorder that predominantly affects the dopamine-producing neurons in a particular area of the brain, known as the substantia nigra. Generally, the cause of Parkinson’s disease is unknown, but both environmental, as well as genetic factors, are believed to cause this illness. The risk factors associated with this disease include age, heredity, gender, and exposure to toxins. While Parkinson’s itself is not fatal in nature, the disease complications could be very serious. According to The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) ratings, complications from Parkinson’s disorder are the 14th cause of death in the United States. An estimated 10 million people suffer from this disease globally and approximately 60,000 people in the States alone are diagnosed with Parkinson’s annually.

The symptoms of Parkinson’s disease are found to generally develop gradually over the years and the progression of these symptoms vary from one individual to the other owing to the diversity of the ailment. In the early stages of Parkinson’s, the most obvious symptoms include, difficulty with walking, slowness in movement, changes in speech and gait, shaking, tremors and rigidity. Further, behavioral and thinking problems, including anxiety and depression may also occur in patients. Other apparent symptoms of this disease include emotional, sensory and sleeping problems. In the more advanced stages of Parkinson’s, Dementia is known to become common. Medical researchers have also observed that numerous changes occur in the brains of the people affected with Parkinson’s such as the presence of Lewy bodies, though the reason behind these changes is unclear. Many of these symptoms are owing to the loss of neurons that produce a chemical messenger in the brain called dopamine, the decrease of which causes abnormal brain activity, leading to Parkinson’s disease.

There is no standard treatment for Parkinson’s disease as the treatment for each individual is based on his or her symptoms. After the diagnosis of this disease, treatments can help relieve symptoms but there is no absolute cure for Parkinson’s. The basic treatments include surgical therapy and medication and other treatments are inclusive of lifestyle modifications such as getting more exercise and rest. There are various medications that are available for the treatment of Parkinson’s, though none that can yet reverse the effects of this disorder. However, rapid technological advancements in the healthcare sector have resulted in the effective tracking and monitoring of the symptoms of Parkinson’s disease. For instance, in June 2018, Apple Inc. announced that the company has added a new “Movement Disorder API” to its open source ResearchKit framework which will enable Apple Watch to uninterruptedly monitor the symptoms of Parkinson’s. Apple launched its ResearchKit framework in 2015 to create opportunities for medical researchers to launch iPhone-based studies and use related apps for medical research purposes. The new “Movement Disorder API” has been developed to offer the app developers using ResearchKit the capability to provide all-day, passive monitoring by means of an Apple Watch running watch OS 5. In order to achieve this, the API would monitor two common symptoms of Parkinson’s that include tremors, indicated by quivering and shaking perceived by the Apple Watch and Dyskinesia, which is a side effect of the Parkinson’s treatment causing swaying and fidgeting motions in patients.

Both the researchers in Apple and outside have been focusing on ways to use the ResearchKit software tools for monitoring mobile device users for an array of disorders and diseases. The Apple Watch is swiftly becoming a beneficial tool for medical researchers for tracking down and monitoring the symptoms associated with Parkinson’s as well as accelerating research with the “Movement Disorder API”. The new API makes studies and researches easier since the algorithms have been developed to report back data correlated with a tremor or quiver resulting from the disorder as opposed to any other motion. Commenting on the development of Apple’s new API, Julie Dodd, Director of Digital Transformation at Parkinson's UK, said: "This is one of the promising developments in wearable tech that could revolutionize our understanding of Parkinson's”. Later in 2018, Apple Inc. is in plans of releasing a software update to make it even simpler for the medical researchers to comprehend the difference between random movements and the dyskinesia and tremors experienced by Parkinson’s patients while getting treated with medications. Further, as all patients would not have the access or affordability for an Apple Watch, the company has started to collaborate with health insurance companies such as Aetna to find ways of subsidizing the costs.

The flame-resistant clothing materials are made with the motive to insulate its users from a fire or a thermal attack, thus eliminating the chances of both second and third degree burn directly through the garments. Apart from providing protection to the workers, these types of clothing could also perform the duties of a handy insurance policy for a business at the accident time.

Reasons behind using the flame-resistant clothing material

The primary reason for this type of clothing is to resist ignition because if the flammable clothing by mistake gets ignited by flash fire, arc flash or any kind of molten metal, the risk of the hazard becomes much greater. In this case, the clothing fire would last for a longer period of time and would also burn the victim to a greater extent. The flame-resistant clothing limits the injury burns. Also, the flame-resistant (FR) clothing is hereto insulate the wearer from the fire and thermal hazard, thus eliminating or reducing any kind of second and third degree burns through the apparels, even in the area that is directly impacted by the thermal hazard.

The major difference between the arc rated and flame-resistant clothing

For encouraging people for specifying and purchasing the fabrics that have been specifically tested for the arc flash hazard, rather than going for purchasing any FR fabric product, the NFPA 70E committee created the “AR” designation. The AR garments have their arc rating displayed in the internal label. The difference between the two lies in the fact that the clothing which has the AR rating is flame resistant (FR), but the truth is not all the FR clothing material has an arc rating. The level of protection of these types of clothing is determined by testing. 

Know the growth of the global arc rated and flame-resistant apparels market

Growing safety concerns of the industrial workers in different industrial sectors including oil and gas, chemical and manufacturing industries are projected to drive a greater market growth for the arc rated and flame-resistant apparels during the forecast period. With the rising incidents of fire and electrically related hazards at different industrial sites is rising the demand for this type of garment. This is driving the growth of the global arc rated and flame-resistant apparels market.

Since all AR clothing is additionally FR, they will give some proportion of protection in case of flash fire. Nonetheless, arc rating is certainly not a prescient factor in flash fire execution; the test standard for that is NFPA 2112. Fabrics pass through this test in the event that they record under half second and third-degree body burn in a 3-second blaze fire (3 seconds since that was the characterized furthest limit of a glimmering fire and under half since survival rates are a lot higher beneath half). The 2112 data is shown as a percent body burn, instead of calories, and in this test the lower the number is, the better the fabric performs.

Once more, all AR fabric is FR, however not all FR fabric have been arc rated. While for all intents and purposes the majority of the top of the line brands have been tried to the two perils, it would be ideal if you ensure you determine and buy textures tried for your dangers at independent labs.

node.body:
The Coronavirus scare has brought the global economy to a virtual standstill. With offices being closed and employees asked to work from home, events being postponed, flight tickets being canceled, and visas being revoked, one can easily say that this is one of the worst crises modern human society has come across in a long time. By now it is futile trying to explain the reason behind this panic. However, to call this, a panic will be a misrepresentation. Besides the obvious scare, every governing body, both national and international, are trying their best to contain the spread of the COVID-19. But, amidst this upheaval, it isnt all gloomy for every business. The Live VR market is looking towards one of the most extraordinary opportunities with the virus scare. 


A Brief About Coronavirus (COVID-19)

Unless any person has been living under the rock all this time, there is no need to introduce the Coronavirus to anyone. However, considering the amount of misinformation being shared over the internet, let us first discuss a few facts about the COVID-19. 


How Can COVID-19 Spread?

Coronavirus is communicable in nature, which means that it has the ability to spread from an affected individual to another. Even though you will find numerous claims that the virus can spread if you have the meat of any animal that is already infected, the claim is untrue to the best of knowledge. 




Common Symptoms Of COVID-19

One of the most baffling things about the COVID-19 is its extreme similarity with normal influenza. The initial symptoms are precisely the same fever, cough, and sore throat. These are quite common in the case of regular influenza. However, within a span of 10 days, these symptoms aggravate, and there are more symptoms such as breathing problems, diarrhea, sputum secretion, body ache, and vomiting. It is, thus, advisable for people facing such symptoms to get themselves checked at the earliest. 


Impact On Sports 

Now that you are updated about the virus and its spread, it should be amply clear as to why the various organizations across the globe are taking such strict measures. However, the year 2020 was promised to be quite an action-filled in terms of sporting events. But, the Corona Virus scare is quite likely to impact these events negatively in terms of audience turnup. We have already witnessed a few major games being played without any spectator. The same can happen with the upcoming sporting events, namely, the ICC World T20, Copa America, Grand Slams, NBA, Sumer Olympics, and such others. We already have confirmation about the Euro 2020, World Athletics Indoor Championship, and IPL 2020 being postponed. Even with the virus being brought under control in the days to come, there is no guarantee that the fans will risk going to the stadium just immediately. Thus, there seems to be a gloomy future for the sports industry. 


Is This An Opportunity For Live VR? 

Come to think of it, almost every negative situation has something positive hidden. And, this might be what the Live VR industry has been waiting for. Live VR, or Live Virtual Reality, has been available for quite some time now. However, adoption has been not that high. But, the COVID-19 scare might just about change that. Major sporting event managers were already considering launching the option of enjoying the sports with the help of Live VR. The best part about this is that the audience will have a virtual experience of watching a live match without having to travel to the venue. This will undoubtedly be an excellent option for many sports enthusiasts across the globe. But the cost has been a somewhat detrimental factor until now. The adoption has been slow, though steady in many parts. However, there is probably nothing better than the risk of falling sick with something potentially life-taking when it comes to giving that final push. 


Live VR Shield Against Viral Exposure 

Before we delve further, lets check out the major benefits that Live VR gives. 

  • Entertainment at the convenience of home! It is an undeniable advantage that the Live VR has, and it has been one of the top USPs when it came to marketing the technology. Just imagine that you are experiencing the electrifying environment of sitting in the best seat of the stadium, while watching your favorite sports stars play, all the while enjoying the comfort of your recliner and gorging on some homemade delicacies! Sounds too good to be true, isnt it? Well, the Live VR set promises just that and delivers on the promise. 
  • Safety guaranteed from any viral exposure. Now, unless you have someone within your home who has contracted the COVID-19, you are safe from getting it while watching the match. The Live VR set will allow you to enjoy all the action, as if you are at the stadium yourself, without you ever coming in close contact with strangers. That certainly sounds like the solution we all need at this time. 
  • With stadiums being vacated, the viewers need not worry about going back to the mundane TV sets. The sporting events will be able to gather a much higher number of eyeballs, and thus subscribers, thanks to the Live VRs. 


It is undeniable that the Live VR seems like the perfect solution in the sporting season to enjoy sports while staying safe and indoors. So, as gloomy as it might be for many other industries, the viral outbreak might turn out to be a blessing in disguise for the virtual reality industry that has been striving for a long time now to create a lasting impact.
